conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible floor plane, and an angled/isometric-like view with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness, readable interior volumes, good cutaway; minor simplification at corners/openings and some missing/soft door geometry.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room massing and main adjacencies (activity/living left, balcony bottom-left, bedrooms to right, bathroom core) generally align, but several plan-defined elements appear simplified or altered (separate WC vs bath unclear/possibly merged, robe/linen partitions not faithfully modeled, stair/recess area in activity zone not represented).

interior_elements.notes: Beds and a sofa are present; bathroom fixtures partially present. No kitchen elements shown (not required by this plan slice, but rubric expects them) and some built-ins (robes/linen) are not modeled as interior elements.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation with good lighting and readable walls/floors; some openings/door locations are harder to verify due to omission of door leaves and simplified glazing.

detected_errors.description: Several layout-defining subspaces/built-ins from the 2D plan (robes/linen partitions and stair/recess area) appear omitted or significantly simplified in 3D.
Bath and separate WC configuration from the 2D plan is not clearly preserved in the 3D model (may be merged or partially missing).
Door placements/swing indications from 2D are not directly verifiable because most doors are modeled as open passages without door leaves.

summary: A genuine 3D cutaway with strong spatial readability, but with notable fidelity losses in the bathroom/WC separation and several plan-specific partitions/built-ins.
